poem:
"Morning's Briefing"

The newsprint, like a bird dropped from the sky, 
Writes tales of turmoil on my breakfast table.
Shadows cross the scone, hints of silent cries,
As armament sales are laid up for debate.
Three English roses wilted under fire,
In Gaza, far from their homeland's dewy heaths.
Ghosts of the past peer from Camerontown spire,
In morning's light, even peace grieves beneath.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
